title.narrative: Amman Smart City Roadmap and Traffic Monitoring Platform TA Project, through CDM International

description.narrative: USTDA is funding this technical assistance (TA) to support the Greater Amman Municipality (GAM) in developing a Smart City Roadmap to inform smart city services development and investment priorities over time. One of the more immediate smart cities initiatives the TA will support is the development and implementation of a Traffic Monitoring Platform Project to help address pressing traffic congestion challenges confronting Amman.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Jordan: Feasibility Study: Virtual Power Plant, through Enon Management, LLC

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study (FS) for Kawar Energy (Kawar), a leading renewable energy company in Jordan, to develop a pilot project for a virtual power plant, a cloud-based system to control, integrate, and aggregate the output of selected solar photovoltaic and battery energy storage systems that the Grantee owns and operates throughout Jordan. This FS will help Kawar anticipate and manage energy transmission during peak and off-peak times more efficiently, and will provide a model for broadly applicable improvements to Jordans electrical grid, which will help reduce the countrys substantial reliance on foreign-sourced energy and fuel.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Jordan: Feasibility Study: Virtual Power Plant, through Enon Management, LLC

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study (FS) for Kawar Energy (Kawar), a leading renewable energy company in Jordan, to develop a pilot project for a "virtual power plant" a cloud-based system to control, integrate, and aggregate the output of selected solar photovoltaic and battery energy storage systems that the Grantee owns and operates throughout Jordan. This FS will help Kawar anticipate and manage energy transmission during peak and off-peak times more efficiently, and will provide a model for broadly applicable improvements to Jordan's electrical grid, which will help reduce the country's substantial reliance on foreign-sourced energy and fuel.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - WeCare Mobile Healthcare Delivery Feasibility Study, through Axipitur LLC

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for NITAJ for Commercial Investments, a Jordanian privately-owned strategic business consultancy, to create Jordan's first private mobile health services. This feasibility study will help NITAJ prepare for the deployment of ten mobile dialysis vehicles and ten mobile clinic vehicles that would serve homebound and underserved patient populations in Jordan's three most heavily populated governates.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Electronic Health Solutions Electronic Health Records Phase II, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant funds technical assistance for Electronic Health Solutions (EHS), a Jordanian government-funded not-for-profit, to support upgrades to two primary and two disaster recovery data centers. This will allow its e-records system, Hakeem to better process the volume of existing and planned new patient data management records and to incorporate additional services.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - King Hussein Cancer Center Artificial Intelligence Initiative, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant funds technical assistance (TA) for the King Hussein Cancer Center (KHCC), Jordan's national cancer center, to develop and implement its artificial intelligence and big data strategy as well as support three artificial intelligence healthcare technology pilot programs. This TA will enable KHCC to provide improved cancer treatment methods for its patients.

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Solar Stean Augmentation Project Proposal Evaluation, through 3E Consulting, LLC

description.narrative: This definitional mission assessed and evaluated a sole-source feasibility study proposal to augment AES Jordan's Amman East gas-fired power plant's power generation through concentrated solar power technology. The solar steam used to boost the steam cycle plant's steam turbine would allow for increased electrical power generation without the consumption of additional fuel.

title.narrative: Desk Study - Electronic Health Records, through Network Dynamics Associates, LLC

description.narrative: This desk study is reviewing a preliminary concept proposal that would provide Electronic Health Solutions (EHS) Company with follow-on technical assistance to facilitate project implementation for the national Electronic Health Records (EHR) program, referred to as the Hakeem pilot project, for Jordan. The program aims to improve health service delivery to all Jordanians by providing a secure and accessible platform that enables the storing and sharing of electronic patient health record at all healthcare facilities enrolled in Hakeem. This program will allow healthcare professionals and patients access to the most up-to-date patient medical information.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Desk Study - Electronic Health Records, through Technical Resources International, Inc.

description.narrative: The Jordan Electronic Health Technologies Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) brought Jordanian health executives to the United States to meet leading U.S. information and communications technology (ICT) companies. The objective of the RTM was to expose leading representatives of Jordan's rapidly expanding health care sector to U.S. products, services, and technologies in order to enhance the U.S. presence in this growing market.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - COMPREHENSIVE TECHNICAL EVALUATION FOR THE JORDANIAN ELECTRICAL SYSTEM, through Government of Jordan

description.narrative: USTDA is providing a $370,000 grant to the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, acting through the Jordanian Ministry of Planning and International Cooperation, acting through the Jordanian National Electric Power Company to fund a Technical Evaluation for the Jordanian Electrical System. The project provides the Grantee with technical expertise pertaining to quality of service; protection and auxiliary systems; incorporating renewable resources into the planning process; restoration plan; and dispatching procedures.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - VESSEL TRAFFIC SYSTEM AND INTEGRATED PORT COMMUNITY SERVICE, through Government of Jordan

description.narrative: USTDA is providing a $418,010 grant to the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, acting through the Jordanian Ministry of Planning and International Cooperation, acting through the Aqaba Development Corporation to partially fund a Feasibility Study (FS) for a Vessel Traffic Service (VTS) and an Integrated Port Communications Information System (IPCIS) for the Port of Aqaba in Jordan. The Grantee is providing a cost share of $46,445 for a total project cost of $464,455. The FS identifies the specific needs for a VTS and IPCIS.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - SMART GRID UPGRADES TO JEPCO NETWORK, through Government of Jordan

description.narrative: This $383,400 grant partially funds a feasibility study to design a smart grid system for the Jordanian Electric Power Company. This study, along with similar USTDA-funded smart grid studies for the two other electricty distribution companies in Jordan, will help the country modernize its electrical grid and incorporate advanced technology to the benefit of both the Grantees, as well as private citizens who will benefit from a more efficient and reliable electrical supply. These smart grid projects complement USTDA's existing energy portfolio in Jordan, which includes projects in renewable energy generation and electricity transmission.
